intro: Pterisanthes quinquefoliolata, commonly known as the five-leaved pterisanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with multiple leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
